channel.title: [PI]Deathlypvpz V3 Cache Downloading Error
channel.description:
For what ever reason my cache isn't downloading correctly. It creates the folder in "C:/" but the cache doesn't unzip into the folder which i believe is what is causing my issues, i have sat here for hours trying to figure out whats wrong, i have tried zipping it differently tons of times, deleted and tried to redownload, etc if anyone has came across a fix for this i would greatly appreciate any help. Thanks. [code]java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\DeathlypvpzV3\Data\62717.dat (The system canno t find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:221) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:110) at CacheDownloader.unzip(CacheDownloader.java:169) at CacheDownloader.unZip(CacheDownloader.java:159) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:55) at client.startUp(client.java:8297) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:84) at client.run(client.java:5287) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\DeathlypvpzV3\Data\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The sys tem cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:146) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:101) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(FileReader.java:58) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:172) at client.startUp(client.java:8298) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:84) at client.run(client.java:5287) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
[/code]
[IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/2mi595h.png[/img]

item.title: [PI]Deathlypvpz V3 Cache Downloading Error
item.dc:creator: @brendonpenwell brendonpenwell
item.description:
@brendonpenwell wrote:

Yes i have done this, the files are both in the correct location in the zipped file. the image above is of my cache directory “C:/” the issue i am having is that the client says the cache is downloading but once it downloads it says error connecting. once the cache completely downloads i go to the cache directory and it actually downloads the zip file into the directory but doesnt make it to unzipping it into the cache location… hopefully this helps make it more clear

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Deathlypvpz V3 Cache Downloading Error
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“xXSh0ckXx, post:2, topic:539915”]Your cache isn’t zipped right. Make sure you don’t have a ‘double directory’. If it’s not the case, then your CacheDownloader isn’t working fine.[/quote]Ignore him…

The files C:\DeathlypvpzV3\Data\62717.dat and C:\DeathlypvpzV3\Data\Maps\mapConfig.txt are not being found. Make sure you unzip them properly into their respective locations or define their new ones so that the applet finds them.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Deathlypvpz V3 Cache Downloading Error
item.dc:creator: @brendonpenwell brendonpenwell
item.description:
@brendonpenwell wrote:

my cache is zipped up just fine, i zipped the files not the folder. i think the private void unzip in the auto cache downloader isnt working correctly because the file downloads but doesnt unzip in the cache directory.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Deathlypvpz V3 Cache Downloading Error
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

Your cache isn’t zipped right. Make sure you don’t have a ‘double directory’. If it’s not the case, then your CacheDownloader isn’t working fine.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Deathlypvpz V3 Cache Downloading Error
item.dc:creator: @brendonpenwell brendonpenwell
item.description:
@brendonpenwell wrote:

For what ever reason my cache isn’t downloading correctly. It creates the folder in “C:/” but the cache doesn’t unzip into the folder which i believe is what is causing my issues, i have sat here for hours trying to figure out whats wrong, i have tried zipping it differently tons of times, deleted and tried to redownload, etc if anyone has came across a fix for this i would greatly appreciate any help. Thanks.
